text: that's four thousand three hundred and
twenty seven pounds Facebook's tax bill
last year is less than what an average
UK worker would have paid in an entire
year so why have they paid so little
well this is down to a number of reasons
one being that it's UK operation
technically may Lots in 2014 this was
down to the fact that it paid its UK
staff more than thirty five million
pounds in bonuses the other reason it's
tax is so low is because Facebook's
headquarters are actually in Ireland
where corporation tax is just 12.5%
nearly half that in the UK well Facebook
is the latest in the long line of
multinational firms to be criticised
over the size of their UK tax bills now
a UK Chancellor George Osborne says he
aims to crack down on tax avoidance in
March of this year Mr Osborne announced
he would be introducing a diverted
profits tax which would penalize
companies that move their profits from
the UK to countries with lower tax rates
